intro: Fumaria agraria subsp. embergeri, commonly known as the Emberger's celandine, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and floral structure compared to the nominate form.
